CONTRIBUTOR'S NOTE:
The Rāmodanta, an anonymous work of unknown date, is a short poetic rendering of the Rāma epics which was traditionally read by beginners in Sanskrit throughout South India (e.g. in Kerala). The present transliterated edition is mainly based on the text of the following edition in Malayāḷam script:
-- Siddharūpaṃ, Bālaprabodhaṃ, Samāsacakraṃ, vyākhyānavuṃ Śrīrāmodantavuṃ, ed. Si. Vi. Raviśarmma Rājāvu [C.V. Ravisarma Raja], Thrissur: Kerala Sahitya Akademi, 2010 (19481).
According to the kaṭapayādi system of writing the numbers, the last word of the work (cinmayaḥ = 6 5 1) indicates that the original number of verses must have been 156, which is the precise number of verses in the Thrissur edition. Close to the text of this edition is the text (in 153 ślokas only) provided by the following two editions here also used:
-- Śrīrāmodantaṃ (samīkṣā vyākhyānaṃ), ed. Ḍo. Pūvattūr Rāmakṛṣṇa Piḷḷa [Dr. Poovattor Ramakrishna Pillai], Thiruvananthapuram - Kottayam: National Book Stall, 1990 [in Malayāḷam script];
-- K.P.A. Menon, Nine Gems of Sanskrit Literature, vol. 3, Delhi: Nag Publishers, 1996, pp. 150-210 [in Devanāgarī script, with an English translation].
There exists another, rather different, version of the same work, which presents a longer text (due to a single passage of more than 50 additional or variant verses) divided into seven kāṇḍas. According to a quick check of a few available manuscripts of the work, it appears that both the kāṇḍa-division and the rewritten and expanded passage occurring within the 6th kāṇḍa, are recent, possibly made by one of the first editors. This interpolated version of the text is represented by the following popular edition:
-- Śrīrāmodantam | lalitaṭippaṇyādisametam | Sriramodanta: A Simple Sanskrit Poetry Text, with exhaustive-notes, valuable grammatical instructions and model questions, edited with foot-notes by L. Anantarama Sastri, Kalpathi (Palghat): R.S. Vadhyar & Sons, 11nd rev. ed. 1982, repr. 2006 [199 ślokas, in Devanāgarī script].
Two parallel editions in e-book form have been made available on-line, which present the same text as the one of the Palghat edition, viz. represent also the expanded version with the kāṇḍa-division:
-- Śrīrāmodantam | Story of Sri Rama (Sanskrit text and English Translation), E-book published by http://hinduebooks.blogspot.com, July 2010 [in Devanāgarī script];
-- Śrīrāmodantaṃ (arthasahitaṃ), E-book published by http://malayalamebooks.org, July 2010 [in Malayāḷam script].
It was not possible for preparing the present edition to check several earlier listed editions such the ones published at the Venkateswara Sastrulu/Vavilla Press or at the Sri Balamanorama Press, Madras. The double numbering of the verses here used allows to have the numbers of the verses according to both versions (the second one being introduced by the sign *). The additional lines or verses from the secondary version are the indented ones with the * reference only. The verses without the sign * are the ones found only in the first version. [Christophe Vielle]

projectDesc.p: The Göttingen Register of Electronic Texts in Indian Languages (GRETIL) is a resource platform providing standardized machine-readable texts in Indian languages that have been contributed by various individuals and institutions.

correction.p: Apparent errors have been silently corrected.

normalization.p: GRETIL normalizes all texts contributed consistently for each language. Sanskrit texts are normalized in accordance with the scheme of the International Alphabet of Sanskrit Transliteration (IAST) in order to facilitate word search across its corpus without additional transformations.

All characters that were fully equivalent to an IAST-conformant character in the text file contributed have been made to conform to the character list below. Non-conformant characters with additional information including accents, capitalization, and whitespace have been preserved as orig elements inside choice elements with their IAST-conformant equivalent in reg elements for the creation of a plain text. These additional informations will be available only in those transformations of this file that display the original information.

quotation.p: If indicated unambiguously in the text file contributed quotation marks have been replaced with the q element and, in case a reference was provided, have been nested inside a cit with the respective reference provided in a ref element after the quote.

segmentation.p: Unnumbered div elements are used to structure the text, using the type and n attributes in accordance with the refsDecl.

interpretation.p:
Interpretive markup which is visible only in analytic transformations of this file consists of:
Highlighting in hi elements,
Corruptions in sic elements,
Remarks in note elements with the @resp attribute identifying the agency.

lg.l: vavrire ca varān iṣṭān asmād āśritavatsalāt //
tebhya etān varān dattvā tatraivāntardadhe prabhuḥ //
laṅkāpurīṃ puṣpakaṃ ca hṛtvā tatrāvasat sukham //
lokān ākramayan sarvāñ jahāra ca vilāsinīḥ //
sthāpayitvā tu laṅkāyām avasac ca cirāya saḥ //
tuṣṭāva ca hṛṣīkeśaṃ vidhātā vividhaiḥ stavaiḥ //
kim artham āgato 'si tvaṃ sākaṃ devagaṇair iti //
padmayonis tu gīrvāṇaiḥ samaṃ prāyāt prahṛṣṭadhīḥ //
sugrīvam api mārtāṇḍo hanumantaṃ ca mārutaḥ //
evam anye ca vibudhāḥ kapīn ajanayan bahūn //
amībhir akhilaiḥ sākaṃ kiṣkindhām adhyuvāsa ca //
bhāryās tisro 'pi labdhvāsau tāsu lebhe na saṃtatim //
etat prāśaya patnīs tvam ity uktvādān nṛpāya saḥ //
tāś ca tatprāśanād eva nṛpād garbham adhārayan //
kṛcchreṇa nṛpatis tasya kauśikasya kare dadau //
astrāṇi ca samagrāṇi tābhyām upadideśa saḥ //
adhvaraṃ ca samārebhe rākṣasāś ca samāgaman //
vijitya bhārgavaṃ rāmam ayodhyāṃ prāpa rāghavaḥ //
tām adhyuvāsa kākutsthaḥ sītayā sahitaḥ sukham //
anujñāpya gurūn sarvān niryayau ca vanāya saḥ //
saṃtyajya svagṛhān sarve paurāś cānuyayur drutam //
guhena satkṛtas tatra niśām ekām uvāsa ca //
rāma rāmeti vilapan dehaṃ tyaktvā divaṃ yayau //
vanāyaiva yayau rāmam ānetuṃ nāgaraiḥ saha //
yayāce rakṣituṃ rājyaṃ vasiṣṭhādyair dvijaiḥ saha //
ity uktvā pāduke dattvā taṃ rāmaḥ pratyayāpayat //
nandigrāme sthitas tābhyāṃ rarakṣa ca vasuṃdharām //
tatpatnī tu tadā sītāṃ bhūṣaṇaiḥ svair abhūṣayat //
brāhmaṃ cāstraṃ ca khaḍgaṃ ca pradadau kumbhasaṃbhavaḥ //
tannirastā lakṣmaṇaṃ ca vavre so'; pi nirākarot //
punaś ca dhikkṛtā tena sītām abhyadravad ruṣā //
sā tu gatvā janasthānaṃ kharāyaitan nyavedayat //
sā tu taṃ mṛgam āhartuṃ bhartāraṃ samayācata //
hā sīte lakṣmaṇety evaṃ rudan prāṇān samatyajat //
tatas tu yācitau tena taddehaṃ dehatuś ca tau //
sugrīvam ṛṣyamūkasthaṃ yāhīty uktvā divaṃ yayau //
prāpya jñātvā tu vṛttāntaṃ tena tau samayojayat //
sakhyaṃ ca kārayām āsa tayoḥ pāvakasaṃnidhau //
darśayiṣyāmi vaidehīm ity anyena ca saṃśrutam //
niveditam aśeṣaṃ ca balādhikyaṃ ca tasya tat //
nirasya kupito bhrātrā raṇaṃ cakre sudāruṇam //
so 'pi rāma iti jñātvā tyaktvā dehaṃ divaṃ yayau //
nyayuṅkta sītām anveṣṭum āśāsu catasṛṣv api //
viśvāsāya tu vaidehyās tad gṛhītvā sa niryayau //
gatvā sītāṃ vicinvantaḥ parvataṃ vindhyam āpnuvan //
te 'tra sampātinā proktāṃ sītāvārttāṃ ca śuśruvuḥ //
taṃ vilaṅghayituṃ teṣāṃ na kaś cid abhavat kṣamaḥ //
pupluve ca gires tasmād vilaṅghayitum arṇavam //
nihatya siṃhikāṃ nītyā pāraṃ prāpa mahodadheḥ //
sītāṃ vicinvann adrākṣīn nidrāṇaṃ niśi rāvaṇaṃ //
aśokavanikāṃ gatvā kāṃ cid ārtāṃ dadarśa saḥ //
āste sma mārutis tatra sīteyam iti tarkayan //
bhāryā bhava mamety evaṃ bahudhā samayācata //
cūḍāmaṇiṃ dadau tasya kare jagrāha so 'pi tam //
hatvā tvāṃ neṣyatīty enām āśvāsya sa viniryayau //
nivedayitvā sakalaṃ dadau cūḍāmaṇiṃ ca tam //
niryayau rāghavas tūrṇaṃ tīraṃ prāpa mahodadheḥ //
kārayitvā tena gatvā suvelaṃ prāpa parvatam //
kumbhakarṇaṃ prabodhyāśu rāmaṃ hantuṃ nyayuṅkta ca //
tān sarvān bodhayitvāśu tatsthāne 'sthāpayac ca tam //
niṣiddhyendrajito homaṃ saṃyuge taṃ jaghāna ca //
niryayau vānaraiḥ sākaṃ rāmo rakṣo'dhipena ca //
ayodhyāṃ prāviśad rāmaḥ prītair bandhujanaiḥ saha //
ayodhyām avasad rāmaḥ sītayā sahitaś ciram //
brahmāstreṇa ca tau baddhvā vānarāṃś cāvadhīc charaiḥ //
mārutiś cauṣadhīs tatrādṛṣṭvā kopaṃ cakāra saḥ //
tāsāṃ gandhena vai sarvān rāghavādīn ajīvayat //
nyayuṅkta kumbhakarṇasya putrau hantuṃ ca rāghavau //
kumbhaṃ rāmo 'vadhīd bāṇair nikumbhaṃ cātmajo raveḥ //
pracodayām āsa sutam yuddhe hantuṃ sa rāghavau //
duḥkhito hanumāṃs tatra yatra ramo 'vrajal laghu //
śrutvā vṛttāntam akhilaṃ rāmo moham avāpa saḥ //
viṣaṇṇān vānarān vācā sāntvayann idam abravīt //
nikumbhilāyāṃ homaṃ tu kṛtaṃ tenādhunā kila //
kṛte home tatra ripur ajeyo bhavati dhruvam //
nikumbhilāṃ prāpa tūrṇam indrajid yatra vartate //
yenāham adya paśyāmi hatam indrajitaṃ raṇe //
rājyād bhraṣṭena dīnena tyaktvā māṃ putra jīvitam //
tādṛk tvaṃ kutra māṃ tyaktvā gato 'dya sudurāsadaḥ //
naya māṃ yatra gantāsi tatra te na vilambanam //
ityāśayā sthitaṃ putra garvitena mayātra hi //
rāmaṃ salakṣmaṇaṃ hantuṃ nirgamiṣyāmy ahaṃ gṛhāt //
rāmeṇa saha saṃgamya yuddhaṃ cakre sudāruṇam //
rarāja rāmo dharmātmā hy udayastho yathā raviḥ //
jaghāna rāmo lakṣmīvān brāhmeṇāstreṇa taṃ raṇe //
tad vaidehyāḥ kṛte rāma sā tu lakṣmīr bhavān svabhūḥ //
lakṣmaṇaś ca tutoṣātha rāmo viśvāsam āyayau //
abhigamyābruvan rāmaṃ dhanyā vayam iti drutam //
āsādya mātaras toṣaṃ tathā prāpur janā bhuvi //
sahitā mantribhiś cakrur vasavo vāsavaṃ yathā //
pūjitaś ca tathā lebhe yathā sītāvalokane //
anujñātaḥ sa rāmeṇa laṅkāṃ prāyād vibhīṣaṇaḥ //
virarāja tathā rāmo yathā viṣṇus triviṣṭape //
khe satāro yathā candras tathā rejuḥ svapattane //
hatvā viprasya kasyāpi mṛtaṃ putram ajīvayat //
ānīya sasutāṃ sītāṃ tasmai prācetaso dadau //
bhūmyā prārthitayā dattaṃ vivaraṃ praviveśa sā //
mānuṣaṃ deham utsṛjya svakaṃ rūpaṃ samāviśat //
nimajjya sarayūtīrthe dehaṃ tyaktvā divaṃ yayuḥ //
rāmo 'pi mānuṣaṃ dehaṃ tyaktvā dhāmāviśat svakam //
rarakṣa lokān vaikuṇṭhaḥ sa māṃ rakṣatu cinmayaḥ //
